intro: Eugenia casarettoana, commonly known as the Casaretto's eugenia, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family, which includes well-known plants like eucalyptus and clove. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers and elliptical, glossy leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
